div.pre: 1647 Naucratis (mod. El Nibeira or El (729) Niqrâsh), 20 km. SE of Damanhûr, 1885 Burial: 450-425 B.C. (Barron) Contents: 15 AR. "Silversmith's hoard," with cast and cut silver lumps, from ex- cavations (42 oz.) Syracuse: 1 tetradr. Athens: 6 tetradr. Aegina: 1 st. Chios: 1 st. Samos: 3 tetradr. Lycia: 1 st. Mallus: 1 st. Cyrene: 1 frag. Disposition: London 4 (BMCLycaonia, p. 95, no. 1; BMCLycia, p. 15, no. 71; BMCCyrenaica, pp. 3-4, no. 11-2); Boston 4 (Brett 1113, 1946, 1953, 1958) † Head, NC 1886, pp. 1-18, illus. (cf. Petrie, Naukratis [London, 1886], p. 63) Dressel, ZfN 1900, p. 258 Barron, Samos, p. 76
